basics.name: Matt Graff
basics.label: Geography and Computer Science (Geomatics) Student at UVic
basics.summary: Passionate about using geospatial technology to solve real-world challenges, I specialize in Python (ArcPy, Pandas), Java, SQL (PostGIS), and ESRI's ArcGIS suite, with a strong interest in improving transportation.

work.name: Avenue Road Property Management
work.summary: At Avenue Road, my role is to aggregate and analyze historical and forecast weather data using Python (pandas) to produce weekly reports, including detailed weather and snow forecasts.

work.name: GeoBC (BC Ministry of Water, Lands & Resource Stewardship)
work.summary: Over my two separate co-op terms, I Independently researched and implemented new methods for storing archival geospatial data on Amazon S3, served via GeoServer. Additionally, I developed an ArcGIS Pro tool in Python to automate the comparison of Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG911) roads and address points.
